meta.title: YOU ARE NOT A FAILURE… YOUR MIND’S BEEN HACKED! How to Reprogram Your Life to Become Successful and Happy
meta.author: Bernhard Richter

parts.title: Journey and Gratitude
parts.body: In the introduction, the author expresses gratitude for the many people and experiences that have influenced his journey, including famous mentors and personal obstacles. He dedicates his book to those feeling trapped by failure and despair, providing hope and a path forward. Through personal stories, the author shows how adversity can be overcome by changing mindsets and embracing potential. With anecdotes from his challenging past, he highlights the importance of perseverance and the realization that success lies within. It's a call to rekindle one's dreams and transform thoughts into positive actions. The author stresses that everyone has what they need to achieve their dreams and encourages readers to overcome feelings of inadequacy by understanding the power of self-belief and motivation.

parts.title: Believe in Your Success and Transform Your Life
parts.body: If you want to succeed and enjoy life, you must truly believe it's possible. This book is designed to help you rekindle hope and make life-changing decisions. You’ll discover ways to clear your negative mindset and find a strong motivating reason to pursue your dreams. It's about gaining the knowledge and insight to face and solve problems preventing your success. The goal is to transform your life, enabling you to become a source of joy and blessing to others. The aim is to explore the keys and principles used by successful people like Henry Ford, Thomas Edison, and Walt Disney. These pioneers persisted despite many failures. Success lies in understanding the invaluable lessons from failures and maintaining a positive attitude. The book details how you can apply these life lessons and success secrets to your own life, pursuing knowledge, cultivating self-confidence, and ultimately achieving financial freedom. Success isn't only about business but also about a mindset that fuels perseverance and allows others to benefit from your accomplishments.

parts.title: Cycle of Success in Life
parts.body: The Cycle of Success isn't just for business—it's part of all aspects of life, like relationships and skills you learn. Realizing you already use success strategies daily, often without knowing, can boost your self-esteem. As a child, learning new things and making them habits contributed to your current success. Success isn't just reaching a high societal bar set by others—it includes your everyday achievements too. Success is in every small step you take toward your goal. Recognize it comes from simple acts like tying shoes or cooking a meal. Acknowledge and celebrate your daily victories. Confidence from small achievements fuels bigger success. Praise fosters a positive attitude transforming you into someone who makes things happen. Winners can't be held back by a negative mindset. Emerson was right, "The only person you are destined to become is the person YOU decide to become."

parts.title: Understanding Negative Influence and Initiating Change
parts.body: Phil grew up in a toxic environment with negative parental influence. His mother's negative words affected him deeply, ultimately leading him towards crime at 17 years old. People judge criminals like Phil harshly, often forgetting the negative upbringing they might have endured. Our attitudes are shaped by early influences, but realizing this can help us change. Reflect on how your past may have influenced negative patterns in your life and know it's not your fault if you didn't realize this before. This awareness allows you to begin a journey towards positive change.

parts.title: Mindset Impacts Success and Interactions
parts.body: When we interact negatively with others, like waving off a cold or dismissing opportunities, we may not realize the impact of our mindset. For example, three postal ladies changed their attitude positively, only to unexpectedly receive kindness and praise from their patrons, improving their own work environment. Success is linked to one's ambition and attitude. Jim Carrey's relentless pursuit in acting proves this: envisioning a $10 million check for his future, he persisted until success. With a "teachable attitude," always be open to learning and listening, even at social events where ideas may spark new ventures. A barbecue talk about making unique fries shows opportunity comes from recognizing and acting on ideas, a path not commonly taken by negative mindsets.

parts.title: The Power of Enthusiasm
parts.body: Enthusiasm is crucial for success. People with positive attitudes are excited about tasks like jobs or chores and infuse everything with joy and energy. The term enthusiasm comes from Greek words meaning to partake in a god's essence, showing how those successful are often spirited and joyous in their work. Everyday duties, even if boring or difficult, are approached with the aim to improve and find fulfillment. Enthusiastic individuals set daily goals and seek opportunities for accomplishment in their tasks, whether at home, work, or elsewhere.

parts.title: Understanding Success
parts.body: This passage emphasizes success and how it is misunderstood. Success originates from the Latin "succedere" meaning "to follow and prosper," implying action is needed. Many people see success as only noteworthy achievements rather than everyday actions. Positive mindset people with positive habits achieve their dreams by following the Cycle of Success—thoughts lead to emotions, then actions, then habits, culminating in success. The example of Brian illustrates that despite setbacks, maintaining enthusiasm and providing excellent service can eventually lead to a successful outcome.

parts.title: Brian's Career Journey
parts.body: Brian, a dedicated waiter, was repeatedly fired and rehired from his job due to customers' false complaints. Despite feeling exploited, Brian maintained a positive attitude and excelled at customer service, which eventually caught the attention of a former customer who offered him a job with a significantly better salary. Recognizing the value of positive behavior, Brian realized he could use his job as a platform for better opportunities, which led to new career success.

parts.title: Positive People and Responsibility
parts.body: Positive people take responsibility, leading by example and ensuring tasks align with expected standards. They plan meticulously, motivate others, and apologize when necessary, leading to trust and success. Responsibility brings authority and the ability to manage tasks effectively. Positive people create a system that works, ensuring everyone has the tools to succeed.

parts.title: Immersive Dream House Visualization
parts.body: This section encourages using your senses to create a mental image of your dream house. It suggests engaging with every aspect, from smelling the interiors, and hearing the natural sounds, to tasting your favorite snack there. By doing this, you feel a sense of ownership and joy as if the house is already yours. After your visit, you're advised to put photos of the house in places you frequently see. This visual reminder serves as motivation and keeps your dream alive, urging you to take action towards making it real. This visualization method bridges the gap between dream and reality by reinforcing a strong mental picture of what you desire.
